content:
That "page" is called account central. It is the same in 115 as all prior versions.

It is not configurable - you can't make it be blank.
creator: wsmwk

content:
The-II1 said
I have several email account managed by TBird. Inexplicably I now have email sent to my "gmail" account, being copied to my "mail" account. This does not occur with all the time, but randomly.

Who is the provider of this "mail" account? Can you post a screen shot?

The-II1 said
Additionally, when I delete an email from my inbox in gmail, it appears in my mail account inbox. I've had these accounts for several years; however, this has just started. Thanks for any assistance.

Check Account Settings > Server Settings > "When I delete a message". What is it set to?
creator: wsmwk

content:
It's version 115.5.1

The provider is mail.com

Server settings on my mail.com account says to move trash to the trash folder on mail.com; on G-mail, move trash to trash folder on G-mail.com
creator: The-II1

content: Sounds like you are crashing. Please post some of your recent crash IDs here. Instructions at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/mozilla-crash-reporter-tb
creator: wsmwk

content:
What solution?..... You are, I think, assuming content that is not here, or some sort of knowledge that I is not in evidence.

I just used the daily build of Thunderbird to drag an account up and down in the list of accounts in account settings those changes were reflected immediately on switching to the tab with the folders and mail using the the all folders view. Are you trying to do something else? Because I will take a lot of convincing that what I just saw happen does not work.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Generally, doing the opposite accomplishes single spacing. If you have any addons, I suggest trying help>troubleshoot mode to see if that corrects it.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello there We have read the messsge We try to help

For example, an add-on can cause a crash and an update can also cause one.

see if you can boot into the so-called trouble shoot mode option.

If you can boot up normally and it doesn't cause a crash then it could be a bad add-on that is the problem, track it down and remove it from your list of add-ons.

Also, this same problem can be caused in the same way with any piece of software on your PC that urgently needs to be removed from your PC machine.

This may also be a bug.

This can be reported if you want?

please report it to us.


https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.5.1/releasenotes/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-add-ons-frequently-asked-questions



Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content: Try this: - click to 'account settings' - scroll down left side to locate account name. highlight it - scroll slightly further down to 'Account Actions', which is a drop-down menu with 'remove account' option.
creator: davidsk
